result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan A Mayer

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  State moves to dismiss and read in along with plea to 15-CM-1243 and Court so orders.

Atty Alyssa Armbrust appearing for Def.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Defendant currently receiving inpatient treatment at Winnebago Mental Health, anticipates will be there for approximately six months, defendant has pending Br 4 case as well.  Counsel to contact court if defendant released to community prior to anticipated release date so matter can be heard at an earlier date.   Plea hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Per request of Atty. Alyssa Armbrust, 12-16-15 Hearing rescheduled to 1-06-16 at 2:45 p.m.
Follow all household rules including attendance at school; No violent contact with BM

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Alyssa Armbrust from the State Public Defenders Office.  Atty. Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Argument on bond.  $500 signature bond set.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
